QUESTION AND ANSWER BOOKLET – INSTRUCTIONS TO CANDIDATES

 Write your session number in the boxes above.
 Do not open this booklet until instructed to do so.
 This booklet contains all the Paper 1 questions.
 Refer to the Text Booklet which accompanies this booklet.
 Section A: answer all the questions in the spaces provided. Each question is allocated [1 mark]
              unless otherwise stated.
 Section B: write your answer to the task in the space provided. The task is worth [20 marks].


LIVRET DE QUESTIONS ET RÉPONSES – INSTRUCTIONS DESTINÉES AUX CANDIDATS

 Écrivez votre numéro de session dans la case ci-dessus.
 N’ouvrez pas ce livret avant d’y être autorisé(e).
 Ce livret contient toutes les questions de l’Épreuve 1.
 Référez-vous au livret de textes qui accompagne ce livret.
 Section A : répondez à toutes les questions dans l’espace réservé à cet effet. Sauf indication
               contraire, chaque question vaut [1 point].
 Section B : écrivez votre réponse dans l’espace réservé à cet effet. Cette tâche vaut [20 points].


CUADERNO DE PREGUNTAS Y RESPUESTAS – INSTRUCCIONES PARA LOS ALUMNOS

 Escriba su número de convocatoria en las casillas de arriba.
 No abra este cuaderno hasta que se lo autoricen.
 Este cuaderno contiene todas las preguntas de la Prueba 1.
 Refiérase al cuaderno de textos que acompaña a este cuaderno.
 Sección A: responda a todas las preguntas en los espacios provistos. Cada pregunta tiene un valor
               de [1 punto] salvo que se indique algo distinto.
 Sección B: escriba su respuesta a la tarea en el espacio provisto. La tarea tiene un valor de
               [20 puntos].

                                                                       SECTION A

TEXT A –– CLIMBING THE BRIDGE

1.    From statements A to L select the five that are true according to Text A. Write the appropriate letters
      (in any order) in the answer boxes provided. An example has been provided.                  [5 marks]


      A.       Mike nearly fell over.                                                                                                        Example:             B
      B.       Each climber had a safety harness.
      C.       Wendy did not answer in words.
      D.       There are no age restrictions for climbers.
      E.       Many famous people have done the climb.
      F.       Getting engaged on the bridge is quite rare.
      G.       The public have been able to climb the bridge since 1932.
      H.       The Sydney Harbour Bridge is the longest steel-arch bridge in the world.
      I.       Some people do the climb at night even in the rain.
      J.       Climbing the bridge is highly praised by many tourist organizations.
      K.       The other climbers were so surprised they remained silent.
      L.       The bridge climb is popular with the people of Sydney.



Answer the following questions.

2.    Why is the Sydney Harbour Bridge so important to the city’s citizens?

      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

3.    What other well-known structure can be seen from the summit?

      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

4.    What aspect of the experience did the writer find the most difficult?

      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

5.    What makes the Sydney Harbour Bridge climb unique?

      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .




8810-2237

                                                          0210
                                                  –3–              N10/2/ABENG/HP1/ENG/TZ0/XX/Q

Choose the most appropriate response from the options below. Write the letter in the answer box provided.

6.    Which of these words best describes the writer’s feeling when the climb was over?

      A.    Exhausted
      B.    Fearful
      C.    Excited
      D.    Disappointed

TEXT B –– THE YOUTUBE BILLIONAIRES

Read Text B and match the headings on the right with the paragraphs in the text. Write the letter in the
answer box provided. Note: there are more options than you need. An example has been provided.


Example: [ – X – ]                     B                    A.       Elephants are cool
                                                            B.       Varied content
7.    [–7–]
                                                            C.       34 million users
8.    [–8–]                                                 D.       Dinner for three
                                                            E.       Motivated by frustration
9.    [–9–]
                                                            F.       Amazingly swift beginning
10.   [ – 10 – ]
                                                            G.       Too many adverts
                                                            H.       Independence
                                                            I.       Amazing success
                                                            J.       Karim leaves the trio


The sentences below are either true or false according to Text B. Tick [  ] the correct response and
then justify it by giving the relevant brief quotation from the text. An example has been provided.
Both the correct response and the correct quotation are required to gain the mark.

                                                                                                                                        True        False
Example: YouTube began in an unlikely location.                                                                                            

      Justification: . . . . . . . . . . . . . . set up in a garage. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

11.   It is impossible to keep up with the new videos on YouTube.

      Justification: . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

12.   Hurley, Chen and Karim all worked for the same firm.

      Justification: . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

13.   The trio had enough cash of their own to get started.

      Justification: . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

14.   YouTube was immediately successful because people talked about it.

      Justification: . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

Match each of the following words from Text B with the word on the right that is closest in meaning.
An example has been provided.


Example: incredible (line 3)         D              A.        progress
                                                    B.        fracture
15.    frustrated (line 10)
                                                    C.        satisfying
16.    breakthrough (line 19)                       D.        astonishing
                                                    E.        annoyed
17.    adamant (line 21)
                                                    F.        bitter
18.    astounded (line 29)
                                                    G.        hopeful
                                                    H.        determined
                                                    I.        bored
                                                    J.        amazed

has been provided.

             In the phrase …               the word/s …                                 refer/s to …

TEXT C –– ALL SUMMER IN A DAY

Read Text C and match the first part of each sentence on the left with the most appropriate ending
on the right. An example has been provided.


Example: The children weren’t completely sure … A                                            A.        that the sun would appear that day.
                                                                                             B.        because they had no photos of it.
22.   The children were very excited …
                                                                                             C.        because of the expected appearance of
23.   Margot looked pale …                                                                             the sun.
                                                                                             D.        because they had been singing about
24.   William was annoyed with Margot …                                                                the sun.
                                                                                             E.        because he couldn’t shove her over.
25.   The children had only vague memories of
      the sun …                                                                              F.        as if the rain had washed the colour
                                                                                                       away.
                                                                                             G.        if they would ever leave Venus.
                                                                                             H.        because she ignored him.
                                                                                             I.        because the other children made her
                                                                                                       angry.
                                                                                             J.        because they had been so young.



Answer the following question.

26.   In line 18, the phrase “Margot stood apart from them” suggests that she isolated herself from them.
      Find three other phrases in the text between lines 25 and 37 which suggest the same thing.			
      		                                                                                        [3 marks]

      (a)   . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

      (b)   . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

      (c)   . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .




8810-2237

                                                      0610
                                                   –7–                 N10/2/ABENG/HP1/ENG/TZ0/XX/Q

Choose the most appropriate response from the options below.              Write the letter in the answer
box provided.

27.   The contrast between “the drum and gush of water” and “the sweet crystal fall of showers”
      (line 11) suggests that …

      A.    the rain on Venus was not always the same.
      B.    there was usually no escape from the rain.
      C.    the raindrops on Venus tasted sweet.
      D.    on Venus it rained both day and night.

28.   The author suggests the enduring nature of the forests on Venus by telling us that …

      A.    they had survived for nine years.
      B.    they grew again after being knocked flat.
      C.    the rocket men planted the forests on Venus.
      D.    the children would always live on Venus.

29.   By “a coin large enough to buy the world with” (line 22) the author suggests …

      A.    the coins used on Venus.
      B.    a child’s coloured pencil.
      C.    the brightness of the sun.
      D.    a child’s drawing of the sun.

30.   The children disliked Margot most of all because she …

      A.    was older than they were.
      B.    liked the continuous rain.
      C.    knew what the sun looked like.
      D.    had brought the rain with her.

31.   The most appropriate alternative title for the text would be …

      A.    “Margot and William”.
      B.    “The Schoolroom”.
      C.    “The Outsider”.
      D.    “The Sun Never Comes”.




8810-2237                                                  Turn over / Tournez la page / Véase al dorso

Questions 32 to 34 refer to lines 33 to 37 in the text. From the list below choose the word which best fits
each numbered gap. Do not use any word more than once. An example has been provided.

                                               although                    before     if

                                               and                         but        unless

                                               because                     during


Example: [ – X – ] . . . . . . . . . . . . And. . . . . . . . . . . . 

32.    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 

33.    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 

34.    . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

                                              SECTION B

TEXT D –– ARE YOU A RESPONSIBLE TRAVELLER?

Complete the following task. Include all the relevant details that you can find, using only the information
in Text D. Write at least 100 words. Do not copy out large sections of the text.

Most members of your class are planning to go on a week’s holiday in a foreign country after the exams.
Knowing that you are interested in responsible tourism, your school principal has asked you to give a talk
to your classmates and their parents with some guidelines about how to travel responsibly. Write the text
of your talk.
